The Training Conspiracy chapter 2
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Library: Fan Fiction, Poetry, Birthday List, Links & Non-Fiction Archive: Short Fiction: The Training Conspiracy chapter 2
By Da_Mullet on Tuesday, February 3, 2004 - 06:27 am:

“The meeting of training assistants will

now come to order! Sit down!” cried a bald man

wearing a green polka dot tie and a red and black

pinstripe suit.

Men and women dressed in the same color

scheme surrounded him, though he was the only one

to wear the official IMA visor, signifying

importance.

Another man with much more hair, and a

beard, spoke. “The first order of business is to

determine the punishment of one assistant who

told our, uh, Secret to a trainer, who then went

mad and ordered her Golem to crush her skull. I

believe we should-”

“Sorry I’m late, did I miss anything? I

couldn’t leave until those fools Torbelphale,

Coltia and their stupid, spoiled, pet of a Snow

Hopper went to sleep. Do go on,” said the female

voice.

Everyone turned to look at the recent

arrival via a high window. Joy the toucan glided

down, landing on the table. She waddled awkwardly

to Colt’s seat, and perched on the

nameplate. “Continue.”

“Very good. Well, one of our members told

a trainer, who is now dead. Pass sentence,

admired one,” said the bald man in the IMA visor.

“Hmmm…I think being flogged by a Golem 40

times would do it,” She cackled evilly, “And use

a whip with glass shards on the ends.”

“Good,” said the bearded man, ”it shall

done as you wish, Master Phoenix."

The bird’s eyes turned red, and she grew

before the terrified eyes of the condemned man.

“Never call me that! You have slighted my

patience, fool!” she said angrily, “Now suffer

the way I have made so many others suffer!”

The man was engulfed in flame even as he

cried in anguish, “It shall never happen again,

Sire! I promise it w- Aaaaaugh!”

The charred skeleton, smelling of burning

flesh, lay on the floor.

“No one shall ever call me that. The

Phoenix is my old life. I am no Phoenix! I am Moo

reincarnate! I am EVIL! HAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA!”

said Joy, her eyes slowly regaining pupils,

though they were still red, vibrantly so.

All the others were sniffling for their

lives, hiding behind furniture. Joy flew off,

laughing maniacally.

By CHB on Wednesday, February 4, 2004 - 07:04 pm:

Double spaced like this is hard to follow. You don't really have an issue directly involved in your writing ability and word usage, but it seems that a plot or even a sink hook are lacking.

I would ask you start with something more original, from your own mind. Know this, I look forward not to what you accomplish next, but what you continue to accomplish and evolve as you progress your ability more and more.

Also realize, as long as you post, I shall read, and give what assistance and comments I can. Keep up the good work.
